qas.question: What sequence of events happens when the power shuts off in a traction elevator and the elevators all stop?

answers.text: One by one, each car in the group will return to the lobby floor, open its doors and shut down

qas.question: What do any passengers experience at this point?

answers.text: People in the remaining elevators may see an indicator light or hear a voice announcement informing them that the elevator will return to the lobby shortly

qas.question: After all cars go to the lobby, what is the next step?

answers.text: the system will then automatically select one or more cars to be used for normal operations and these cars will return to service

qas.question: How are the selected cars then readied for passengers?

answers.text: The car(s) selected to run under emergency power can be manually overridden by a key or strip switch in the lobby

qas.question: What is a safety feature to prevent entrapment?

answers.text: when the system detects that it is running low on power, it will bring the running cars to the lobby or nearest floor, open the doors and shut down

context: When power is lost in a traction elevator system, all elevators will initially come to a halt. <a0_0>One by one, each car in the group will return to the lobby floor, open its doors and shut down<a0_0/>. <a1_0>People in the remaining elevators may see an indicator light or hear a voice announcement informing them that the elevator will return to the lobby shortly<a1_0/>. Once all cars have successfully returned, <a2_0>the system will then automatically select one or more cars to be used for normal operations and these cars will return to service<a2_0/>. <a3_0>The car(s) selected to run under emergency power can be manually overridden by a key or strip switch in the lobby<a3_0/>. In order to help prevent entrapment, <a4_0>when the system detects that it is running low on power, it will bring the running cars to the lobby or nearest floor, open the doors and shut down<a4_0/>.
